revised_title: Surviving in the Sea: Surf-Riding on Size Spectra and Life-History Strategies
tldr: This article explores how marine species survive in temperate and Arctic shelf seas by "surf-riding" on the annual wave of productivity in the size spectrum. The authors develop a simple model that focuses on seasonal changes in predator and prey abundance, highlighting the importance of size as a determinant of survival in the sea and the life-history strategies that species must follow to thrive in these ecosystems.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine Ecology
